Generation I.Red: A Pok é mon that has been overhunted almost to extinction. It can ferry people across the water.
Generation I.Green: (This entry was originally untranslated in English until it was reused in Pokémon FireRed .)
Generation I.Blue: A Pok é mon that has been overhunted almost to extinction. It can ferry people across the water.
Generation I.Yellow: A gentle soul that can read the minds of people. It can ferry people across the sea on its back.
Generation I.Stadium: Capable of understanding the language of humans, it enjoys ferrying people on its back. It is on the verge of extinction.

Generation II.Gold: They have gentle hearts. Because they rarely fight, many have been caught. Their number has dwindled.
Generation II.Silver: It ferries people across the sea on its back. It may sing an enchanting cry if it is in a good mood.
Generation II.Crystal: This gentle Pok é mon loves to give people rides and provides a very comfortable way to get around.
Generation II.Stadium 2: They have gentle hearts. Because they rarely fight, many have been caught. Their number has dwindled. (Pokémon Red, Silver, or Crystal inserted) It ferries people across the sea on its back. It may sing an enchanting cry if it is in a good mood. (Pokémon Blue, Gold, or Yellow inserted)

Generation III.Ruby: People have driven Lapras almost to the point of extinction. In the evenings, this Pok é mon is said to sing plaintively as it seeks what few others of its kind still remain.
Generation III.Sapphire: People have driven Lapras almost to the point of extinction. In the evenings, this Pok é mon is said to sing plaintively as it seeks what few others of its kind still remain.
Generation III.Emerald: People have driven Lapras almost to the point of extinction. In the evenings, it is said to sing plaintively as it seeks what few others of its kind still remain.
Generation III.FireRed: Its high intelligence enables it to understand human speech. It likes to ferry people on its back.
Generation III.LeafGreen: A Pok é mon that has been overhunted almost to extinction. It can ferry people on its back.

Generation IV.Diamond: It loves crossing the sea with people and Pokémon on its back. It understands human speech.
Generation IV.Pearl: It loves crossing the sea with people and Pokémon on its back. It understands human speech.
Generation IV.Platinum: It loves crossing the sea with people and Pokémon on its back. It understands human speech.
Generation IV.HeartGold: They have gentle hearts. Because they rarely fight, many have been caught. Their number has dwindled.
Generation IV.SoulSilver: It ferries people across the sea on its back. It may sing an enchanting cry if it is in a good mood.

Generation V.Black: It loves crossing the sea with people and Pokémon on its back. It understands human speech.
Generation V.White: It loves crossing the sea with people and Pokémon on its back. It understands human speech.
Generation V.Black 2: Able to understand human speech and very intelligent, it loves to swim in the sea with people on its back.
Generation V.White 2: Able to understand human speech and very intelligent, it loves to swim in the sea with people on its back.

Generation VI.X: They have gentle hearts. Because they rarely fight, many have been caught. Their number has dwindled.
Generation VI.Y: Its high intelligence enables it to understand human speech. It likes to ferry people on its back.
Generation VI.Omega Ruby: People have driven Lapras almost to the point of extinction. In the evenings, this Pokémon is said to sing plaintively as it seeks what few others of its kind still remain.
Generation VI.Alpha Sapphire: People have driven Lapras almost to the point of extinction. In the evenings, this Pokémon is said to sing plaintively as it seeks what few others of its kind still remain.

Generation VII.Sun: Its high intelligence enables it to comprehend human speech. When it's in a good mood, it sings in its beautiful voice.
Generation VII.Moon: These Pokémon were once near extinction due to poaching. Following protective regulations, there is now an overabundance of them.
Generation VII.Ultra Sun: It likes swimming around with people on its back. In the Alola region, it's an important means of transportation over water.
Generation VII.Ultra Moon: They've been so cherished that there's now an overabundance. The fish Pokémon population has declined in waters with too many Lapras.
Generation VII.Let's Go Pikachu: A gentle soul that can understand human speech. It can ferry people across the sea on its back.
Generation VII.Let's Go Eevee: A gentle soul that can understand human speech. It can ferry people across the sea on its back.

Generation VIII.Sword: A smart and kindhearted Pokémon, it glides across the surface of the sea while its beautiful song echoes around it.
Generation VIII.Shield: Crossing icy seas is no issue for this cold-resistant Pokémon. Its smooth skin is a little cool to the touch.
Generation VIII.Brilliant Diamond: It loves crossing the sea with people and Pokémon on its back. It understands human speech.
Generation VIII.Shining Pearl: It loves crossing the sea with people and Pokémon on its back. It understands human speech.

Generation IX.Scarlet: It ferries people across the sea on its back. It may sing an enchanting cry if it is in a good mood.
Generation IX.Violet: Able to understand human speech and very intelligent, it loves to swim in the sea with people on its back.
